IV. Business Model and Governance Features
• Locally-Majority Ownership: iVerify will be incorporated and headquartered in developing regions with majority equity ownership held by its local partners, ensuring governance and economic benefits are centered within the communities it serves.
• Strategic Integration & Technology Transfer: The North Star Group, led by Michael Hoffman, provides the foundational technology platform and strategic integration services. Their role is strategic, focused on successful technology transfer and long-term partnership, acting as the Systems Integrator.
• Local Management: The founder's team will not have an active role in the day-to-day operations of iVerify, which will be fully managed by its local leadership.
• Equity Model: For their foundational contribution, the North Star Group expects to retain between 15% and 25% of the total project equity.
• Revenue Generation Model: The business model is built on partnership and aims to capture a small fraction of the value the platform creates. It is free to use for producers, with the economic value generated from enabling access to premium markets funding the entire system.
• Pilot Program Ready: The core technology is built, field-proven, and ready for deployment in a targeted, funded pilot program to create real-world case studies and validate the operational model. Pilot objectives include deploying the core app, installing a Sentinel Tower, and gathering 6-12 months of verifiable data.
